titleStmt.title: Molly Mogg A Song set by an Eminent Master

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Says my Uncle I pray you discover, what has been ye Cause of your Woes;
that yu whine & you pine like a Lover.I've seen Molly Mogg of the Rose.
O Nephew your grief is but follyin Town you may have better Progg
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly-·-·-a Molly much better than Mogg
Half·a·Crown·&c. (2)
The School Boys Delight is a play Day, The Masters Delight is to Flogg;
The Milk Maids Delight is on May DayBut mine is in sweet Molly Mogg
Will a Wisp leads ye Trav'ler a gaddingThrough Ditch & thro' Quagmire & Bogg
But no Light can e'er set me a maddingLike ye Eyes of my sweet Molly Mogg(3)
For Guineas in other Mens Breeches Your Gamesters will palm & will Cogg
But I envy them none of their RichesSo I palm my sweet Molly Mogg
I know that by Wits 'tis recitedThat Women at best are a Clogg
But I'm not so easily frightedFrom loving my sweet Molly Mogg.(4)
Who follows all Ladies of Pleasure In Pleasure is counted a Hogg
All ye sex cannot give so good MeasureOf Joys as my sweet Molly Mogg
The Heart when half wounded is changingIt here and there leaps like a Frogg
But my Heart can never be ranging'Tis so fix'd upon sweet Molly Mogg.(5)
I feel I'm in Love to Distraction My Sences quite lost in a Fogg
And nothing can give SatisfactionLike thinking of sweet Molly Mogg
A Letter when I am inditingComes Cupid and gives me a Jogg
And I fill all my Paper with writingOf nothing but sweet Molly Mogg.(6)
If I would not give up the three Graces I wish I were hang'd like a Dogg
And at Court all ye Drawing Room FacesFor a Glimpse of my sweet Molly Mogg
Those Faces want Nature and SpiritAnd seem as cut out of a Logg
Juno, Venus and Pallas's MeritUnite in my sweet Molly Mogg(7)
Were Virgil alive with his Phillis And writing another Eclogue
Both his Phillis and fair AmarillisHe'd give up for my sweet Molly Mogg
When she smiles on each Guest like her liquorThen Jealousy sets me a gogg
To be sure she's a Bit for the VicarSo I shall loose sweet Molly MoggY29-26X3
